perturbation.original_text:
10.1 Term. This Agreement shall commence as of the Effective Date and shall continue in effect for one (I) year, unless earlier terminated as
expressly provided in Sections 1.3. 10.1. or 10.2 of this Agreement (the *Initial Term"). This Agreement shall automatically renew beyond the
Initial Term for successive one (I) year terms (each, a "Renewal Term"), unless a Party provides the other with written notice of termination at least
one hundred eighty (180) days prior to the expiration of the Initial Term or the then-current Renewal Term. Regardless of the term, Licensee can
terminate Agreement with at least one hundred eighty (180) days written notice with no further obligation.
perturbation.changed_text:
10.1 Term. This Agreement shall commence as of the Effective Date and shall continue in effect for one (I) year, unless earlier terminated as
expressly provided in Sections 1.3. 10.1. or 10.2 of this Agreement (the *Initial Term"). This Agreement shall automatically renew beyond the
Initial Term for successive one (I) year terms (each, a "Renewal Term"), unless a Party provides the other with written notice of termination at least
one hundred eighty (180) days prior to the expiration of the Initial Term or the then-current Renewal Term. Regardless of the term, Licensee can
terminate Agreement with at least thirty (30) days written notice with no further obligation.
perturbation.explanation: The original text requires Licensee to give one hundred eighty (180) days written notice to terminate Agreement, but the modified version states the the Licensee can terminate Agreement with at least thirty (30) days written notice with no further obligation. This creates contradictory instructions about the duration of required written notice for the Licensee. It is unclear about which rule the Licensee should follow.

perturbation.original_text:
5.1 Proprietary Rights of Licensee. As between Licensee and VOTOCAST, Licensee Content shall remain the sole and exclusive property
of Licensee, including, without limitation, all copyrights, trademarks, patents, trade secrets, and any other proprietary rights. Except as provided in
this Section 6.1 nothing in this Agreement shall be construed to grant VOTOCAST any ownership rights in, or license to, the Licensee Content
provided by Licensee or Licensee Users. Licensee hereby grants to VOTOCAST a non-exclusive, worldwide, royalty-free license during the term of
this Agreement to edit, modify. adapt. translate, exhibit, publish, transmit, participate in the transfer of, reproduce, create derivative works from,
distribute, perform, display and otherwise use Licensee Content as necessary to render Services to Licensee under this Agreement.
perturbation.changed_text:
5.1 Proprietary Rights of Licensee. As between Licensee and VOTOCAST, Licensee Content shall remain the sole and exclusive property
of VOTOCAST, including, without limitation, all copyrights, trademarks, patents, trade secrets, and any other proprietary rights. Except as provided in
this Section 6.1 nothing in this Agreement shall be construed to grant Licensee any ownership rights in, or license to, the Licensee Content
provided by Licensee or Licensee Users. Licensee hereby grants to VOTOCAST a non-exclusive, worldwide, royalty-free license during the term of
this Agreement to edit, modify. adapt. translate, exhibit, publish, transmit, participate in the transfer of, reproduce, create derivative works from,
distribute, perform, display and otherwise use Licensee Content as necessary to render Services to Licensee under this Agreement.
perturbation.explanation: The original text states that the Licensee Content shall remain the sole and exclusive property of Licensee. The modified text, however, states that the Licensee Content shall remain the sole and exclusive property of VOTOCAST. It is now contradictory and unclear which party owns the Licensee content.

perturbation.original_text:
1.1 Grant of License. Under the terms and conditions of this Agreement, VOTOCAST hereby grants to Licensee a nonexclusive,
nontransferable license, to access the Services and provide Licensee's users ("Licensee Users") with access to the Services. Licensee may not
transfer the license granted in this Agreement unless such transfer is mutually agreed upon by the Parties in a writing signed by the Parties.
VOTOCAST reserves all rights under any intellectual property rights in and to the Services not expressly granted in this Agreement.
perturbation.changed_text:
1.1 Grant of License. Under the terms and conditions of this Agreement, VOTOCAST hereby grants to Licensee an exclusive,
transferable license, to access the Services and provide Licensee's users ("Licensee Users") with access to the Services. Licensee may
transfer the license granted in this Agreement without needing mutual consent from the Parties in a writing signed by the Parties.
VOTOCAST reserves all rights under any intellectual property rights in and to the Services not expressly granted in this Agreement.
perturbation.explanation: The original text grants a nonexclusive and nontransferable license to the Licensee, requiring mutual agreement for transfer. The modified text grants an exclusive and transferable license, allowing transfer without mutual consent. This creates a direct contradiction regarding the nature and transferability of the license, causing uncertainty about the Licensee's rights and obligations.
